intro: Triptilion ramulosum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered in dense tufts, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spike-like inflorescences. Triptilion ramulosum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
